summary: The Protect and Serve Act of 2025 amends Title 18 of the United States Code to punish crimes targeting law enforcement officers. It introduces a new section (120) that outlines penalties for assaulting law enforcement officers, with harsher penalties for serious bodily injury, death, kidnapping, or attempts to kill. The bill also details circumstances under which these penalties apply, including interstate travel, use of commerce channels, use of weapons, interference with economic activity, and cases involving federal officers. It includes a certification requirement from the Attorney General for federal prosecution and defines key terms.
